William A. Hatchl Procurement Manager Mission Enabling, Code 210.M November 2, 2004

page.title:
Assembling a Contract File
Assembling a Contract File
page.enlisting:
• The green Official Contract File has 8 tabs, counting the inside front and back covers. – These tabs were once labeled A through H • These instructions apply when an entire file’s contents can fit into a single Official Contract File. – These instructions can also be used to cross-reference the location • File the earliest document at the bottom and the latest • In most cases, each individual document and paper should be individually tabbed for easy reference. • The green Official Contract File has 8 tabs, counting the
• The green Official Contract File has 8 tabs, counting the

page.title:
Tab A – Supporting Papers for the Contract
Tab A – Supporting Papers for the
Contract
page.enlisting:
• Follow the Checklist for Contract Award File Content (NASA Form 1098) and Virtual Procurement Office (VPO) to determine what documents apply to your new procurement – A completed NF 1098 should be placed at the top of all – GSFC Form 210-94 (Stand-Alone PNM) useful to use as well • Use the tab numbering system, placing the lowest applicable tab at the bottom – The earliest document goes at the bottom of each tab, (e. g., versions of proposals) labeled with its own sub- tab (e. g., Tab 64A, 64B, 64C) • Follow the Checklist for Contract Award File Content
• Follow the Checklist for Contract Award File Content

page.title:
Tab B – Original Contract and Modifications
Tab B – Original Contract and
Modifications
page.enlisting:
• File the original signature version of the contract and each modification, including applicable attachments. – Contract filed at the bottom with the latest • Consider creating a modification log and filing a current copy at the top of this tab. • File the original signature version of the
• File the original signature version of the

Tab C – Supporting Papers for
Modifications

page.title:
Tab D – Secondary Administration Documents
Tab D – Secondary Administration
Documents
page.enlisting:
• File such documents separately under their • Examples would include COTR • Often Award Synopsis (NF 1098 item #80) • File such documents separately under their

page.title:
Tab E - Miscellaneous Papers
Tab E - Miscellaneous Papers
page.enlisting:
• File documents that do not belong under other tabs (e.g. General Correspondence)
• File documents that do not belong under
other tabs (e.g. General Correspondence)

page.title:
Tab F – Financial Reports
Tab F – Financial Reports
page.enlisting:
• File monthly and quarterly 533 reports,
• File monthly and quarterly 533 reports, resource analyst reports, etc.
resource analyst reports, etc.

page.title:
Tab G - Vouchers, Invoices, and Receiving and Inspection (R&I) Reports
Tab G - Vouchers, Invoices, and
Receiving and Inspection (R&I) Reports
page.enlisting:
• File cost vouchers, fee invoices, and R&I reports (e. g., DD 250 Material Inspection and Receiving Reports) – File cost vouchers, etc. under separate tabs • Consider creating a voucher and invoice log and filing a current copy of the top of this tab (SAP data doesn’t automatically track to individual invoices)
• File cost vouchers, fee invoices, and R&I
reports (e. g., DD 250 Material Inspection
and Receiving Reports)
– File cost vouchers, etc. under separate tabs
• Consider creating a voucher and invoice log
and filing a current copy of the top of this
tab (SAP data doesn’t automatically track to
individual invoices)

page.title:
Tab H - Post Award Reports
Tab H - Post Award Reports
page.enlisting:
• File technical progress reports, final reports, Government property reports (NF 1018), new technology reports, subcontracting reports (SF 294 and 295). etc.
• File technical progress reports, final reports,
Government property reports (NF 1018),
new technology reports, subcontracting
reports (SF 294 and 295). etc.

page.title:
General Effectiveness Tips
General Effectiveness Tips
page.enlisting:
• Keep the File Neat & Well Organized (saves time in long • Use pre-printed labels (file available on P drive) • Center the 2-hole punch (align the middle of your papers with the middle of the punch—holes should be equidistant from mid-point of paper) • File Analysis Should be Complete, Concise, Timely, and Accurate (c.f. 210 Attributes of Excellence). • When in Doubt, Leave it in • Show Your Ownership of the File • Keep the File Neat & Well Organized (saves time in long

page.title:
Preparing Your Procurement Action for Review
Preparing Your Procurement Action
for Review
page.enlisting:
• Use the NF 1098 in conjunction with the NASA VPO (& GSFC 210- 94) to determine what documents and actions will be required to complete your individual procurement action (1098 not necessarily needed in file) • Remember to place supporting documents on the left hand side and the • Consider creating a contract review file (i.e. “Chrono”) to accompany contract actions in the review cycle – Copies of the contract and all modifications • Make your review file as complete as you can; remember that most • Refer to GSFC R&A Matrix (GSFC Procurement Circular 98-2) to • Use the NF 1098 in conjunction with the NASA VPO (& GSFC 210- 94) to determine what documents and actions will be required to complete your individual procurement action (1098 not necessarily needed in file)

page.title:
Effectively Using the NF 1098 and VPO • The NF 1098 is organized chronologically, from the first to the last procurement action needed to complete an individual procurement action.
Effectively Using the NF 1098 and
VPO
• The NF 1098 is organized chronologically, from
the first to the last procurement action needed to
complete an individual procurement action.
page.enlisting:
• If you are placing a sole source justification into the review cycle, generally you should have already completed any documents and actions for applicable lower-numbered tabs – Include annotations as to their status if your review file does not make their status clear (e. g., that document is not included in your file) (i.e. memo, copy, post-it note) – Leaving such status unclear will only cause the • If you are placing a sole source justification into the review cycle, generally you should have already completed any documents and actions for applicable lower-numbered tabs – Include annotations as to their status if your review file does not make their status clear (e. g., that document is not included in your file) (i.e. memo, copy, post-it note)
• If you are placing a sole source justification into
the review cycle, generally you should have
already completed any documents and actions for
applicable lower-numbered tabs
– Include annotations as to their status if your review file
does not make their status clear (e. g., that document is
not included in your file) (i.e. memo, copy, post-it note)
– Leaving such status unclear will only cause the
– Leaving such status unclear will only cause the
reviewer to question whether you have overlooked it
reviewer to question whether you have overlooked it

page.title:
Effectively Using the NF 1098 and VPO
Effectively Using the NF 1098 and
VPO
page.enlisting:
• Both guides include relevant regulatory • Large contracts or mods require multiple files. Have a 1098 in each file, showing which file contains which documents • Both guides include relevant regulatory
• Both guides include relevant regulatory
